pageContext.claim: “The Evangelicals have been so amazing to us. They voted 84 percent and doubled and tripled the numbers that ever voted in an election before.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump exaggerates when he says "double and triple the numbers" before. Exit polls show white evangelical voters voted in high numbers for Donald Trump, 80-16 percent. That’s the most they have voted for a Republican presidential candidate since 2004, when they overwhelmingly chose President George W. Bush by a margin of 78-21 percent.
